channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A tradition for turkeys: Another presidential pardon
item.description: What is a presidential turkey pardon – and why is it happening again?

item.title: 8 economic insights we're grateful for
item.description: For this Thanksgiving, Planet Money and The Indicator staffers offer economic insights they're grateful for.

item.title: Russian attacks kill at least 6 in Ukraine as talks on peace plan continue
item.description: Russia launched attacks on Ukraine's capital with at least six people killed in strikes that hit city buildings and energy infrastructure. The attacks...

item.title: Italy's Campi Flegrei supervolcano is stirring. Could this seismic giant soon erupt?
item.description: The volcano near Naples is shaking the ground in a way that scientists say it hasn't for centuries, posing risks for hundreds of thousands of people l...

item.title: Utah Gov. Cox appealed for civility after Charlie Kirk's murder. Did America listen?
item.description: After right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was assassinated, Utah Gov. Spencer Cox called for civility. NPR's Steve Inskeep spoke with him at a meeting of...

item.title: UK minister flags visa 'abuse' as student asylum claims surge
item.description: More than 14,000 students on study visas sought asylum this year to June 2025 according to Home Office figures.

item.title: Ever consider "adopting" a turkey for Thanksgiving?
item.description: An increasing number of farm animal sanctuaries nationwide have started promoting an alternative version of Thanksgiving in which families "adopt" tur...

item.title: Tanzania cancels independence day celebrations after election unrest
item.description: The opposition has been rallying people to gather on that day to protest against post-poll killings.

item.title: Drugs soaked into pages of "Hillbilly Elegy" were snuck into Ohio prison
item.description: An Ohio man has been sentenced to more than ten years behind bars for sneaking drugs into an Ohio prison by spraying them into pages of Vice President...

item.title: South Korea's 'TV dad' Lee Soon-jae dies at 91
item.description: Lee became a beloved household name for his famous roles in films and on TV for nearly 70 years.

item.title: Watch: Moment truck collides with sign on Ohio highway
item.description: The vehicle was travelling along Ohio’s I-70, with the dramatic collision occurring in Columbus last Thursday.

item.title: Rad e-bike batteries pose a fire risk and shouldn't be used, agency says
item.description: Rad Power Bikes contends that its batteries are safe and that the commission's demand would force it to close.

item.title: Army Secretary Driscoll meeting with Russians in UAE amid push for peace deal
item.description: U.S. Army Secretary Dan Driscoll is in Abu Dhabi to meet with Russian officials, two U.S. officials and two diplomatic sources who were not authorized...

item.title: 2 climbers fall to their deaths on New Zealand's highest mountain
item.description: The climbers' bodies have been found and specialist searchers were working to recover them "in a challenging alpine environment," police said.

item.title: Ukraine calls for Trump-Zelensky meeting in US this week
item.description: Meanwhile, the US has confirmed its officials are set to meet Russian representatives in Abu Dhabi

item.title: Wisconsin woman in 2014 Slender Man stabbing is found a day after walking away from group home
Pentagon says it’s investigating Sen. Mark Kelly over video urging troops to defy ‘illegal orders’
Thousands of arrests by Trump’s crime-fighting task force in Memphis strain crowded jail and courts
item.description: A task force ordered by President Donald Trump to combat crime in Memphis, Tennessee, has made thousands of arrests.
